author: ChevreDeFeu
description:
Basic Tenshi combos for beginners

The goal of this Trial is to make beginners
used to Tenshi's combo structure and the
mechanics of both the game and the character,
hence why most of these combos aren't optimal
Credit:
LunaTriv for giving his Tenshi knowledge
Coffeedant for playtesting it regularly since
the beginning and providing the image above
name: Basic Combos

scenarios.description:
5AAA, 5A > 5AA > 5AAA or Dial A
Whatever you call it, it's the first step for
getting into any character's combo game

1525 damage
Doesn't give a knockdown
scenarios.name: 5AAA

scenarios.description:
5AA > 2B > [Spell]
Really simple spell confirm structure, pretty
much every character have something similar to
it
5AA will make both reversals (3SC and 5SC)
whiff, go for 5A > [Spell]
Just know that Tenshi's meter is mostly used
for its utility as Tenshi's non-metered combos
already do great damage once they're optimised
scenarios.name: Basic Metered Combo

scenarios.description:
5AA > 2B > 5C > d623C
A good combo to know for beginners until they
learn Tenshi's optimised combos.
d623C does slightly more damage than d623B

3222 damage (lvl 0 d623)
Small Oki Window
scenarios.name: 5A d623 Confirm

scenarios.description:
5A > 3A > 2C > HJ9 > J6B > J66 > J5A > J8A
A combo that works everywhere and doesn't
depend on any skill
Also works with 4A, 2A or raw 3A starter

2322 damage
Medium Oki Window
scenarios.name: Universal 5A Confirm

scenarios.description:
5AAA > 4A > 2B > 2C > J5A > J8A
A good combo to know for beginners until they
learn Tenshi's optimised combos
Delay 4A slightly for optimal damage

2853 damage
Medium Oki Window
scenarios.name: 5AAA Deep Corner

scenarios.description:
66A > d623C
A simple combo that gives a knockdown from
non-metered 66A
C version does slightly more damage

1228 damage (lvl 0 d623)
Small Oki Window
scenarios.name: 66A d623 Confirm

scenarios.description:
2B > HJ8 > J6B > J66 > J5A > J8A
A combo that starts from a Drill hitting an
aerial opponent
Works with any drills as starters, including
air drills

2293 damage
Medium Oki Window
scenarios.name: Anti-Air Drills Loops

scenarios.description:
J5A > J8A > J2C > JD9 > J5A > J8A > J2C
Tenshi's most common Air / Air conversion,
also works with j8A starter

2267 damage
Medium Oki Window
scenarios.name: Standard Air / Air Conversion

scenarios.description:
66A > 4SC > HJ9 > J6B > J66 > J5A > J8A
An explanation of how Tenshi's 4SC works
followed by a combo using it
This combo will do less damage the closer
to the corner you are

5238 damage
Medium Oki Window
scenarios.name: 4SC Temperament Meteorical Revelation

scenarios.description:
CH d22B > d22B > 3A
An explanation of how the Monsoon weather
works followed by a combo exclusive to it
Unoptimal, even at lvl max

2284 damage(lvl 0 d22)
Big Oki Window
scenarios.name: Monsoon Concept

scenarios.description:
d22B > d214B > a236B "Heaven and Earth Press"
An explanation of how the Blue Sky weather
works followed by a combo exclusive to it
May have inconsistent damage due to a236's
multihits dropping

2010 damage (lvl 0 d22 / d214 lvl 1 a236)
Medium Oki Window
scenarios.name: Blue Sky Concept

scenarios.description:
5AA > 2B > HJ8 > J2B > JD3 > J5A > 5AAA
A sight of what comes next!
Unoptimal version of Tenshi's most emblematic
combo structure
Do 2A > 3A ender instead of 5AAA if you run
a214 Quake

2882 damage
Big Oki Window
scenarios.name: Deep Corner Drill Loop

scenarios.description:
5A > 6B > HJ9 > J2B > JD3 > J5A > 5AAA
A sight of what comes next!
Unoptimal version of Tenshi's most emblematic
combo structure
Do 2A > 3A ender instead of 5AAA if you run
a214 Quake

2624 damage
Big Oki Window
scenarios.name: Midscreen Drill Loop
